title: Thermostring Quantization. Interpretation of Strings as Particles at Finite Temperature
abstract: Temperature paths of a point particle in the space - temperature manyfold can be represented as strings with length L=1 /kT (thermostrings). During the time evolution the thermostring swept any surface in the space-time-temperature manyfold. The thermostring is closed, it's points can be rearranged and the charge is to be distributed along the length. Some predictions of thermostring quantization for statistical mechanics and string theory cases are discussed. It is shown that superstrings IIA and heterotic strings can be interpreted as thermostrings at Planck temperature.
